setNumberOfRepeats

public void setNumberOfRepeats(int numberOfRepeats)
See getNumberOfRepeats. The actual value is made positive with a minimum defined by a constant.

Gets the number of dots per repeat in the inside boundary of the grid.

setDotsPerRepeat

public void setDotsPerRepeat(int dotsPerRepeat)
Sets the number of dots per repeat in the inside boundary of the grid. May reset the leg ratios of subsequent DensityChange objects.

public void setDotsPerRepeat(java.lang.String dotsPerRepeat)
Idem.

getInnerCircle

public ConcentricCircle getInnerCircle()
Gets the inside boundary of the grid.

getOuterCircle

public ConcentricCircle getOuterCircle()
Gets the outside boundary of the grid.

getAngleOnFootside

public int getAngleOnFootside()
Gets the angle between diagonals and circles. Dots are placed on alternating positions per circle. Drawing lines through the dots gives a figure like below: 
 ________
  \ /\ /
 __V__V__
The angle between the outside of the V and the inner circle is given.

setAngleOnFootside

public void setAngleOnFootside(int angleOnFootside)
See getAngleOnFootside. The actual value is kept safely between 0 and 90 degrees. The safe minium and maximum values are defined by constants. Unsafe values are of no practical use for bobbin lace makers and could stress the system too much.

setAngleOnFootside

public void setAngleOnFootside(java.lang.String angleOnFootside)
Idem.

getRepeats

public java.awt.geom.Line2D[] getRepeats()
Creates lines from the center of the grid to the first dot of each repeat.

getBoundaries

public java.awt.geom.Arc2D[] getBoundaries()
Gets arcs stretching out along one repeat, indicating the boundaries and density changes.

getAllDots

public java.awt.geom.Point2D[] getAllDots()
Gets the co-ordinates for all dots of the grid.
